full_summary:
**Tender Announcement: Information Management Architect - Level 2**

**Official Title:**
---------------

* English:  Information Management Architect - Level 2
* French: Architecte en gestion de l'information - Niveau 2

**Reference Information:**
------------------------

* Reference Number: CB-185-97061316
* Solicitation Number: W3330-24-255 A
* Amendment Number: 1
* Publication Date: 2023-12-21
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-01-11, 14:00 Eastern Standard Time (EST)

**Notice Type:**
-------------

* English: Request for Proposal
* French: Demande de propositions

**Procurement Information:**
-------------------------

* Procurement Category: SRV (Service)
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Selective tendering
* Trade Agreements: Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, and others

**Scope of Work:**
----------------

The Department of National Defence (DND) and the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) require an Information Management Architect to assist with the development and evolution of Microsoft D365 initiatives. The successful candidate will act as a technical lead to support the technical requirements specified in the Request for Proposal (RFP) statement of work.

**Security Requirements:**
----------------------

* Common PS SRCL #6 applies
* Minimum Corporate Security Required: Designated Organization Screening (DOS)
* Minimum Resource Security Required: RELIABILITY STATUS

**Contact Information:**
----------------------

* CIO Gp Procurement / DPI Groupe d'approvisionnement
* Email: IMBIDS.OFFRESGI@forces.gc.ca
* Phone: (343) 598-6483
    
**Notice:**
----------

* This notice cancels and supersedes previous notice number W3330-24-255 dated October 31, 2023, with a closing date of November 15, 2023, 02:00 PM EST.
* A debriefing or feedback session will be provided upon request to bidders/offerors/suppliers who bid on the previous solicitation. 

Note:  Only qualified TBIPS Supply Arrangement Holders who met the specified requirements for Stream 3 services in the National Capital Region are eligible to submit proposals. The contractor retains the right to negotiate with any supplier in this procurement. Answers will be provided in one or both official languages. 

**Helpful Links
